titleStmt.title: A funeral monument or the manner of the herse of the most renowned Robert Devereux, Earl of Essex and Ewe, Viscount Hereford, L. Ferrers of Charley, Bourchier and Lovaine, Englands late Lord Generall, who deceased Septemb. 14. 1646. VVith a briefe recitement of his valour and fidelity in the kingdomes just cause, against the enemies of religion, Parliament and kingdome, whose funerall is to be solemnized on Tuesday the 13. of October, 1646.

A funeral monument or the manner of the herse of the most renowned Robert Devereux, Earl of Essex and Ewe, Viscount Hereford, L. Ferrers of Charley, Bourchier and Lovaine, Englands late Lord Generall, who deceased Septemb. 14. 1646. VVith a briefe recitement of his valour and fidelity in the kingdomes just cause, against the enemies of religion, Parliament and kingdome, whose funerall is to be solemnized on Tuesday the 13. of October, 1646.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Hancock in Popes-head Alley,

notesStmt.note: In verse: "England's great Essex Death hath snatcht away," ...
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
